page.title: 09Niton-The Lighthouse(pg.2)
page.content:
The main navigation light is powered by a 3kw.bulb with a back up system of an identical bulb and a gas light.This has a flash sequence of one flash every 5 seconds,visible at a nominal range of 30 miles.The intensity of the light is 5,250,000 candle power.
In May 1985 a new monitor was placed in the Lt/Ho.which monitors the Nab Lt/Ho.which lies on the east side of the Island.Also,in the near future, equipment will be installed to monitor the Calshot Spit Light Vessel which lies north of Cowes.
During the Second World War the Station was bombed on 1st.June 1943. The main watchroom/engine section was completely destroyed with the loss of life of all three keepers,who were buried in Niton Parish Churchyard.
